title: How long should a nonfiction book chapter be? - Quora

response.answer_text: The lengths of book chapters can vary widely. Chapters are typically organized according to time, events or content rather than length per se. The first chapter may introduce the main characters and “set the stage” for what is about to happen. Subsequent chapters may be organized according to a timeline, or around certain events. Chapter organization is important, but doesn’t have to be determined primarily by length. But it is probably best to avoid super-long chapters except in rare cases. When I read a book, if I’m going to pause I usually wait for the end of a chapter. Extremely long chapters can be a bit frustrating, so I would advise finding logical places to separate really long chapters into shorter chapters, if only to give readers places to stop and insert bookmarks.

There is no definitive answer to how long a chapter should be. A chapter should be as long as it needs to be, whether that is one word or 1000. Chapters are meant to divide a book into manageable sections of thought and time, and to make intelligent breaks in the course of the story.
